Reviews.Title: A possible fix for all those who's Emerson won't come back on.
Reviews.Author: Angela Streiff
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV online at WalMart.com durring BlackFriday like many other people. I had no idea what I was getting myself in to.This TV was for my home office. So it receives minimal use. Two weeks after buying it and setting it up, it stopped working. Probably only had 8 hours total ever even being turned on.I was trying everything I could think of. Assuming I must have done something, unplugged something, etc. Nothing worked. I then turned to Google, only to find that litteraly thousands of people have posted all over the internet about buying Emerson TV's and that they suddenly stopped working weeks or months later. I could not believe how many sites I found with people desperately trying to figure out why their TV's just stopped working right after buying them.Everything I found basically said it was a lost cause. I was ready to pack the TV up and take it back to the store. But before I did, I wanted to be able to say I had tried everything to get it to work again (I hate returning things, so a TV was going to be a BIG hassel). I would push the power button on the TV itself and I would get this flashing red light in the lower right side of the TV by the button, over the words that said standby.In a crazy effort to see if something would work to get it back on, I just randomly started pushing buttons on the TV. I found that if you press and HOLD the power button while repeatedly pressing the MENU button over and over, suddenly the TV flashed and powered up. No idea why!My TV has done it several time again. Where one day it just doesn't turn on, but if I do that same thing again, it always comes back to life. It would seem that it's actually getting stuck in some kind of "standby" mode, and unable to power up. But holding the power button while tapping the menu button seems to override what evers going on inside and can bring it back to life.This I'm sure is not going to be a fix for everyone. But if when you try and press the power button on the TV itself (not using the remote), you get a flashing red light in the lower right side of the TV, you may have the same issue as I do and I would try the fix I mentioned.In addition, the sound is really bad. I am by no means picky when it comes to the sound from my TV. As long as I can hear it, I'm happy. I don't know what they did with the speakers in this TV, but if you can envision an AM radio turned on with a large tin can over it, that's the sound you get no matter how you adjust it. Words are often hard to even decipher. I've bought $8 computer speakers with better sound. So to hear anything, you're almost forced to set up external speakers.As for anyone looking to buy this TV, I would NOT recommend it. Google "Emerson 32 inch TV problems" and you will see why. The consumer affairs site has hundreds and hundreds of complaints saying the same thing. The only reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 is because there are some people out there who do get TV's that work, but this brand has a lot more lemons than ANY other I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: Decent Entry Level HD TV
Reviews.Author: KMA
Reviews.Content: I got this TV knowing some of its flaws. It is a perfect TV for those wanting to start and HD set up but don't want to spend a thousand and some on a set up.Pros: 32" great size for average sized living room or space you are putting this in.The picture is crisp and clear; as long as you are using HD inputs and video sources of course.Has a "auto-on" and auto-off" if any device hooked via HDMI supports it, when turned on like a Bluray player or gaming console the TV will automatically turn on and move the the right input. The auto-ff with the device doesn't seem to work all the time but only on cretin devices.Cons: The refresh rate of this TV is quite low and can result in "smearing" or "bleeding" if the picture moves too fast. It isn't as noticeable in bright scenes but darker ones you can see it (I know the TV would do this after all it isn't very high end.) The base of the TV is secured with four Philips screws, while this really ins't a major issue, it can be cumbersome to move it since it cannot go back into its original packaging without it off.It does lack a VGA computer input. While this isn't such a problem anymore with modern Desktops and Laptops both having an HDMI out, plus VGA is a low resolution SD input anyway so not too much of a problem unless you don't have a machine with HDMI out.720P while to me this ins't a con, I find that a lot of people that want HD want the highest available, that would be 1080P, however, this in my opinion is an entry level HD TV, and 720P still offers an amazing picture; it also costs less money than Full HD systems.Conclusion:Overall this TV is nice for what it is. Obviously it isn't the best out there but that isn't what the price suggests. while you may find others better for this price I do find that this TV does live up to what it can do. the imige it offers is crisp, clear, and vibrant. Decent TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Emerson LC320EMX 32" LCD HDTV 720p REFURB
Reviews.Author: Natalie Kilpatrick
Reviews.Content: I have yet to voice a single complaint about this television. For the price it's well built and displays a wonderful picture. The blacks are true blacks, not greys like you see in some of the other pricier models, and there's hardly any, if no pixelation whatsoever.Not once in the past two years of owning this TV have I encountered any problems such as the TV never turning on or the like (perhaps because it's a refurb).It has three HDMI ports, one on the side, two in the back, plus your standard A/V hookups, coax hookup, USB and S-Video.You have four options of viewing size with the TV (Cinema, Zoom, etc.), power saving mode and more.These have dropped in price considerably on the secondary market making them one of the most affordable HDTVs out there, some even in only double digits.Typically, you get what you pay for, but if you're getting a refurb Emerson LC320EMX you won't be disappointed. It's a lovely television that's been fixed to last long!

Reviews.Title: not worth it
Reviews.Author: Larissa Todman
Reviews.Content: I got this tv as a gift and i honestly wish the person who bought it for me would have googled "problems with emerson tv's " before wasting their money.  It's a shame how many people are complaining about these Tv's that work for 3 months then the power supply dies which must be faulty but still used anyway...there should be a recall on this product!

Reviews.Title: Emerson sucks at customer sevice
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I had a problem when you try to contact emerson for customer support you get a answering machine that says they will call right back and they never do . Ill never buy anything emerson again.

Reviews.Title: Don't was your money
Reviews.Author: bajan907
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Wal-mart on Black Friday for $248.  It worked for a few months then started acting up. TV started working again, thought everything was fine.  Now it's not working again.  It first started shutting down by itself, volume go up and down by itself, menu window open and close and start creating it's own settings.  I started to think the TV was piousest.  Point blank the TV was acting crazy.  Make: Emerson and model: LC320EMXF

Reviews.Title: Connections to DVD/Wii don't work
Reviews.Author: jensrib
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on Black Friday at Walmart for $188 when I found out a friend was going to the store to get one for himself - I just said "get me one too".  I had done no research before hand.  The hook-up for the TV was very easy, and the picture is beautiful.  When I tried to hook up my DVD player and/or my Wii, the TV didn't recognize that something was connected.  The HDMI cable for my DVR works just fine.  I even tried a splicer for the cables to add to it - that didn't help either.  It didn't recognize the 6 prong cable or the 3 prong cable.  Walmart is being very good about returning it - I don't have the original reciept as it was bought on my friend's credit card, and 6 weeks later I don't have the original box either.  They are allowing me to pay the difference for a comparable Vizio (that I had in the past and LOVED) that has more connections as well.  Basically - not a bad TV, but disappointed that the jacks don't work.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Munky
Reviews.Content: I definitely feel like I got a great TV for the price I paid.  It has even survived traveling on the road for 6 months!

Reviews.Title: Decent for the price
Reviews.Author: 4today
Reviews.Content: I bought this Emerson 32" HDTV on Black Friday for $198.00 and couldn't be happier. Much to my surprise, set up was a breeze, had my set humming in 5 minutes flat.  I am using the HDTV without a set top box, the HD channels come in crystal clear, the non-HD channels are not as clear up close but look great once you are a few feet away from the screen.  I do wish I could program my remote to operate my DVD player but for the price I can live without it.

Reviews.Title: Great for such a low price!  (2ND review, 1+ year after)
Reviews.Author: JMB
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV this last Black Friday for only $188 at WalMart.  This is also my first lcd/led TV.  Graphics and sound are excellent, I've seen many vizio and phillips at friends' and cousins' houses and the graphics are kind of slow.  I tipically use this TV for gamin and it works excellent.  Some reviewers say their's didn't work maybe I got lucky, since mine works perfectly fine.  Let's see how it comes out in the long run, hahaha.*Yep, after a year it still works perfectly fine... Enough said.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV - very happy with the buy
Reviews.Author: C. Palanisamy
Reviews.Content: I got this TV in the thanksgiving sale at walmart. Great TV! Absolutely excellent picure quality and sound clarity; I could understand the dialogues which previously I couldn't understand. Very easy to set up. I don't find any difference in picture quality and sound between this tv and a SONY. I would recommend this product to anyone!Only missing thing was a headphone jack. Not a big deal; u can buy a Y cable for a dollar from dollar store!

Reviews.Title: awesome tv
Reviews.Author: tiffanyking75
Reviews.Content: I love this tv great sound wonderful price and amazing picture quality i had my first one for 2 yrs i went back about a week a go and bought 2 more!

Reviews.Title: Worst remote control signal ever
Reviews.Author: AD
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV during Walmart's Black Friday sale. I've had it on for about 7-9 hours a day since Christmas. I haven't had the random blackouts or power supply issues that other owners have had, but there is one very annoying thing about this TV: the remote signal.First, some context. Prior to this, I owned a little 17" Vizio. This is another budget brand offered in Walmart, but after four years of constant use, it never had any problems whatsoever, and the picture was great. But on top of that, the remote could change the channels/volume from three rooms away. No kidding. I used to bounce the signal off door knobs and somehow it would pick it up, even though no knobs actually faced the TV.The Emerson remote, however, cannot do this. In fact, you have to basically be standing directly two-feet in front of the TV in order for it to pick up the signal. Even then, you have to point the remote directly at the base of the TV. Any deviation will result in a failure to pick up the signal.This is without a doubt the worst remote I've ever used. Now I just hope I don't have the longevity problems that everyone else does. I'll be updating this review as time goes on.

Reviews.Title: Good for a childs room or play room
Reviews.Author: Nicole Garrett
Reviews.Content: I got this as a black Friday deal. My daughter needed a new tv as she only had a tube tv. It has yet to disappoint. The only thing I can say is that the sound quality isn't the best. Not something I would put in my living room at all. It is worth the $99 I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Just died
Reviews.Author: Marge Taylor
Reviews.Content: Bought this model and after just a few months we were watching it and the screen went black.  Tried to turn back on with remote and on tv and nothing.  Tried the hold power and push the menu repeatedly nothing.  Paid almost $200.I expected better quality from Emerson.  Wish I would have read reviews of this model first, so disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value and Quality
Reviews.Author: Allen Ferreira
Reviews.Content: I have had this television in my room for about two years now and have never had a single issue with it. I use it regularly and use it frequently for ps3. The 720p quality is very nice. Its not 1080p but ive seen 1080p tvs that don't look as nice, especially at 32in.I give it four stars due to the fact that it is very light, almost too light, it could have been built out of stronger material and It can easily be knocked over by a child. I wouldnt advise this for a kids room or even a living room but this is great for a bedroom.

Reviews.Title: No reliability problems, great picture, horrible sound.
Reviews.Author: Sean S
Reviews.Content: I have not had any reliability problems with this television. Had it for 1 year now but it is only used a few weeks per year in a summer house. Main reason was the price and the picture seemed good.One year on..... I still think the picture is good.. Contrast is as good as my Samsung at home and at 32in the movies are very sharp and colorful. Great job on that and heck of a bang for your buck.Here's where the wheels fall off the cart. The sound or speakers in particular are fine for standard television and news programs..... But the buzz like a set of hair clippers during ALL movies. There is not really an excuse for this.... I have heard this complaint from a few people. Why not spend an extra few bucks on decent speakers... If they did then it would have been a great five star television in my mind.

Reviews.Title: Really good tv!!!
Reviews.Author: truthbetold777
Reviews.Content: I have had this t.v for over a year, and I had to write a review due to seeing how some have had such a negative experience. I was trying to find a 1080p tv that was 32 inches. Seems they are hard to find, and speaking to the guys at target, with t.vs being 32inches or smaller 720p will seem like 1080p. I took it home hooked up my LG blue ray player via HDMI connection to t.v. I don't have cable since its too expensive at this time. Set up Netflix and man it is amazing!!! It's such a sharp picture, I can see sweat and shiny glossy skin, dark and lights are so clear. Sound isn't bad, but I made it better by hooking up the audio plugs from back of blue ray player to stereo using red and white colored sound part of a/v connectors you can get at store.usually these a/v wires come with blue ray player (don't use the yellow colored wire), that's the video plug- in that you don't need since your using HDMI. Just an amazing tv worth getting, just as good as my Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Have had no problems with this TV
Reviews.Author: Loves to Travel
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews, I hope I'm not jinxing myself. I bought this TV during Wal-Mart's Black Friday, 2009 and I have thoroughly enjoyed it and have had absolutely no problems what so ever.  It was super easy to setup, did it in a flash, I've had none of the problems others have mentioned.  The only thing I wish I could adjust better is the sound, I have super sensitive ears and sometimes the pitch in the sound slightly bothers my ears, but for the price, I can live with it.  I initially bought two of these sets at the same time and took one back just because I didn't really need two and decided to spend the money on something else, I wish I would have kept it.  I must have been one of the people who lucked out on this model....and happy that I did.Emerson LC320EMXF 32" Class LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: dominicangirl
Reviews.Content: Great tv for the price, it's a 720 but looks like a 1040. I recommend it 100%. Very pleased with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: rio valley
Reviews.Content: I won this beautiful TV at a bingo. An I just love it. The picture is so clear and well what i am trying to say it is great. And it didn't cost me a penny.

Reviews.Title: Not a bargain at all
Reviews.Author: Thomas C. Jameson "Gomer"
Reviews.Content: Got this TV for Christmas.  Very frustrating in that it has no TV guide built in (to the remote?), and all you can see on INFO button is what show you're on... not what's coming up, have to change channels to see what's on those channels, etc.  It could be that with a different remote you could see that.  I'll give it two stars since it hasn't quit on me (yet).  Don't know about the reliability, since I haven't had it all that long.  But - it's an Emerson.  I have faith it'll die, after reading some of these reviews.  What don't people understand about buying cheap brands???  THEY ARE NO BARGAIN!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good but there are draw backs.
Reviews.Author: Ravenx00754
Reviews.Content: I went a bought this t.v. at walmart yesterday, It worked...at first. It wasn't even in use for 10 minutes when it desided to stop working. I called Emerson's tech line, they couldn't help me at all....bummer. I'm taking it back to exchange it for a new one today. This is my early christmas present, so much for a good one. I'll give this t.v. another chance sure, but what are the odds of purchasing one that doesn't work. Very cheap tho!! I got my new tv and I've had it for about a year now, it works great the picture quality is good but not the best. Good tv for the price tho.

Reviews.Title: so clear
Reviews.Author: true crime reader
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy the big screan but the 12 inch but I love it. The picture of cristel clean & the color is beautiful. Great TV.
